ProgramName: Master of Science in Accounting Data Analytics and Technology
EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for all students who did not complete their entire bachelor’s degree in a country where English is the official language. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT (88), IELTS (7.0), Pearson PTE (61), Duolingo English Test (115).
Requirements:
In addition to the University graduate admission requirements, the following are required for the Lubin School of Business:

- Completion of the online application form
- Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended
- GMAT/GRE is not required.
- Resume
- Statement of Purpose
- Two letters of recommendation
- $70 non-refundable application fee
Description: The MS in Accounting Data Analytics and Technology program provides a unique blend of accounting, data analytics, and technology to meet the market needs for accountants and auditors with advanced data analytics skills. The accounting profession is in the midst of a technological disruption. Accounting professionals are expected to go beyond the debits and credits and become tech-savvy professionals. They should not only be skilled in accounting and auditing, but they also must have skills in data analytics and information systems that allow them to make informed decisions. This new program will provide a unique blend of accounting, data analytics, and technology to meet the new market needs for accountants and auditors with data analytics skills. This program is a STEM-designated program and is registered with the New York State Education Department for 150-credit hour-licensure.
Accredidation: The Lubin School of Business is dually accredited in business and accounting by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International, an elite distinction shared by fewer than 2% of business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Accounting, Public Accounting, CPA Prep
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Pearson Test of English (PTE). Minimum score requirements are as follows: TOEFL IBT: 88, IELTS: 7.0, and Pearson PTE: 61.
Requirements:
In addition to the university-wide application and admission requirements, applicants to the Public Accounting, CPA Prep MBA must have completed an undergraduate degree in business with a major in accounting. Students without this background will be referred to the MS in Accounting program. Exceptions to this policy may be made on a case-by-case basis.

The GMAT/GRE is required for admission; however, the GMAT/GRE may be waived for admission if certain criteria are met. Please see the Lubin Graduate Admission page for more details.
Description: The Master of Business Administration in Public Accounting prepares students for entry and career advancement in the field of public accountancy by providing a course of study that satisfies the educational requirements for CPA licensure in New York State. While it is geared to the CPA candidate who lacks an undergraduate accounting degree, the program also provides a broader business perspective necessary for advancement to the highest levels of management. The Lubin School of Business is dually accredited in both business and accounting by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International, an elite distinction shared by few other business schools in the world.
Accredidation: The Lubin School of Business is dually accredited in both business and accounting by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International, an elite distinction shared by few other business schools in the world.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Accounting, Public Accounting, CPA Prep
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Acceptable proofs of proficiency include: TOEFL score of 88 (iBT), IELTS score of 7.0, Pearson PTE score of 61, Duolingo English Test score of 115, or Successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center in the United States.
Requirements:
In addition to the university-wide requirements, the MS in Accounting requires the following:

1. A completed application form.
2. A non-refundable application fee.
3. A current resume.
4. A personal statement (500 words or less) that describes the applicant’s reason for pursuing this graduate degree.
5. Official transcripts from all post-secondary schools attended.
6. Two letters of recommendation.
7. GMAT/GRE test scores are optional. Applicants who don’t submit test scores will not be penalized. Applicants who feel their GMAT/GRE scores will strengthen their application are welcome to submit them.
8. International applicants must also submit an English language proficiency test score.
Description: The Lubin MS in Accounting program will provide you with the critical knowledge of accounting principles and business applications to prepare you for a successful career. Our program is designed to create a path for you to become a certified public accountant (CPA). Students who complete the MS in Accounting program will satisfy the 150-credit-hour New York State requirement for CPA licensure and gain the analytical and technical skills that today's top firms and corporations are seeking. As an added benefit, we offer a CPA review course at a significantly reduced price for our graduate accounting students. We offer the accounting program in both New York City and Westchester.
Accredidation: Pace University's Lubin School of Business is accredited for both business and accounting by AACSB International-The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. This elite distinction is held by fewer than 2% of business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Applied AI
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be done by submitting the official score report from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson PTE academic, or Duolingo English Test.
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Description: The Master of Science in Applied Artificial Intelligence (MS in AAI) program focuses on giving students a practical understanding of AI technologies and their applications in a variety of industries. Unlike traditional AI master’s programs that emphasize research and theory, this degree focuses on the practical application of AI. The curriculum covers a wide range of topics, including AI algorithms, natural language processing, deep learning, computer vision, and the development and management of AI projects. The program provides students with real-world problems and data sets, so that they can apply what they learn in class to real-world situations, preparing them for the challenges they will face in their careers. Students will gain the skills necessary to develop AI applications from start to finish, from initial design and data gathering to final deployment and maintenance. Our graduates will be well-prepared to take on positions as AI application developers, AI solution architects, AI project managers, and machine learning engineers, and to drive innovation and growth in their respective industries.
ScholarshipType: Pace Graduate Grants, Pace Graduate Scholarships, Restricted and Endowed Scholarships, Graduate Assistantships

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Arts and Entertainment Management
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Pace University accepts the following examinations to satisfy this requirement: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic, or the Duolingo English Test. Completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112 will also be accepted.
Description:
The Lubin MBA program is designed for business professionals and recent graduates who want to make a difference in their organizations and their communities. We combine the theory, application, and experience students need to become leaders who can create opportunities in a dynamic global business environment. Students develop analytical, practical, and interpersonal skills in a curriculum that gives them a solid foundation in all functional areas of business, as well as the flexibility to specialize in their areas of interest. The program prepares students to become leaders and provides a clear pathway to success and professional growth.

The Arts and Entertainment Management concentration focuses on the business aspects of producing and managing artists, artistic organizations, and events. Students gain comprehensive business expertise with a special focus on businesses that produce and manage artistic events, organizations, and artists in the non-profit and for-profit sectors.
Accredidation: The Lubin School of Business at Pace University is among the less than 2% of business schools worldwide that are dual accredited by AACSB International—the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business—in both business and accounting.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Arts and Entertainment Management
EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must submit proof of English proficiency. We accept the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, Pearson PTE, and Duolingo English Test. Test scores are considered valid for two years. English proficiency test may be waived if you have completed, or are in the process of completing, a bachelor's, master's or doctoral degree from an institution in the United States or from a country where English is an official language and the language of instruction.
Requirements:
In addition to the University graduate admission requirements, the following are required:

One letter of recommendation is required
Resume
Personal statement
Description: The Master of Science in Arts and Entertainment Management is a 36-credit hour graduate degree that combines business and management theories with industry expertise to prepare students for leadership careers in creative industries. Arts and entertainment organizations are unique cultural enterprises. They face a range of challenges in their efforts to be artistically innovative and financially stable, and to provide stimulating work environments. This program provides students with the critical skills and professional experience needed to meet these challenges.
ScholarshipAmount: The Welcome to Pace Scholarship amount is $4,000 for the first year.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit a minimum Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score of 88 (Internet-based version), or a minimum International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 7.0, or a Pearson PTE score of 61, or a Duolingo English Test score of 125.
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Description:
The Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence is a 30-credit program that provides students with a comprehensive understanding of AI theory and technologies. Students will learn how to design and build AI systems, apply AI techniques to solve real-world problems, and evaluate the ethical and social implications of AI. The program will prepare students for careers in the rapidly growing field of AI, in roles such as AI researcher, AI engineer, machine learning engineer, and data scientist. The program is offered fully online and asynchronously so students can advance their careers from anywhere in the world.

Program Learning Outcomes
Upon completion of the program, students will be able to:
- Demonstrate knowledge of AI and machine learning techniques and their applications.
- Design and develop AI systems using a variety of tools and platforms.
- Analyze and interpret data using statistical and machine learning methods.
- Apply ethical principles and professional responsibilities in the development and deployment of AI systems.
- Communicate technical concepts and results to both technical and non-technical audiences.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT: 80, IELTS: 6.5, Pearson PTE: 54, Duolingo English Test: 115. You may be exempt from this requirement if you have completed two or more years of study, or have earned a bachelor's or master's degree, at an institution in the United States, United Kingdom, Australia, Canada (except Quebec), New Zealand, or Ireland.
Requirements: Completed online application; Application fee; A Statement of Purpose, approximately 500 words, describing your reasons for applying to the MS in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, your professional goals and aspirations, and how this program will help you achieve them; Two letters of recommendation, at least one academic; Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended; Resume/CV; A bachelor’s degree in chemistry, biology or a related field with a GPA of 3.0 or higher from an accredited institution. Students with a GPA lower than 3.0 may be considered for admission on a conditional basis; Evidence of having completed the following college-level courses with a grade of B or better: Two semesters of general chemistry with lab, Two semesters of organic chemistry with lab, Two semesters of general biology with lab, One semester of biochemistry or molecular biology, One semester of physics, One semester of calculus.
Department: Dyson College of Arts and Sciences
Description: Our Master of Science in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology degree program offers you the laboratory experience and the academic background for a successful career in a wide variety of settings, including biotechnology, pharmaceutical, academic, or government laboratories. The program’s mission is to provide you with a high-quality education in the current theories and techniques of biochemistry and molecular biology in a diverse and nurturing learning environment that prepares students for employment or advanced degree programs.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration/Juris Doctor in Business Administration
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). The recommended TOEFL score is 100 on the internet-based test (IBT). The recommended IELTS score is 7.0.
Department: Elisabeth Haub School of Law and Lubin School of Business
Description: Earn your Juris Doctor (JD) and a Master of Business Administration (MBA) in our highly-regarded joint-degree program. You’ll be uniquely prepared to solve complex challenges at the intersection of law and business, giving you a competitive edge in a wide variety of legal and business fields. Pace University is the only law school in the New York metropolitan area to offer a 4-year joint JD/MBA degree in business. This highly competitive program is a partnership between the Elisabeth Haub School of Law and the Lubin School of Business, both highly respected and nationally-ranked schools. You’ll become a part of our extensive alumni network of more than 8,000 in law and 30,000 in business, many of whom have reached the pinnacle of success in their fields. Benefit from our prime location in the business and legal hub of Westchester County, as well as our proximity to New York City, and access countless opportunities to build the skills you need for a career at the nexus of business and law.
Accredidation: The Elisabeth Haub School of Law is approved by the Council of the Section of Legal Education and Admissions to the Bar of the American Bar Association (ABA). The Lubin School of Business is dually accredited in business and accounting by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International.
CostPerCredit: $2,205 per credit for Law courses; $1,450 per credit for Business courses

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Business Analytics
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. A minimum TOEFL iBT score of 88, a minimum IELTS score of 7.0, a minimum Pearson PTE score of 61, or a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 125 is required.
Requirements: The Office of Graduate Admission requires the following for the MBA in Business Analytics program: Completed online application; Resume; Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended; One letter of recommendation; Personal Statement; Official GMAT/GRE scores: GMAT/GRE waivers are available for qualified candidates.; $70 non-refundable application fee; Official TOEFL, IELTS, or Pearson PTE academic scores are required of all applicants who did not complete their undergraduate or a graduate degree in the United States.
Description: The MBA in Business Analytics program provides students with the skills and knowledge to analyze large data sets to make effective business decisions. Students gain a comprehensive understanding of business functional areas and quantitative skills and expertise in various analytical tools. The program is an intensive, 12-18-month program for students with strong quantitative backgrounds. The 39-credit MBA in Business Analytics curriculum provides a solid understanding of business fundamentals along with specialized expertise in business analytics. Our graduates are highly sought after by firms in finance, marketing, and operations. The MBA in Business Analytics program has STEM designation.
Accredidation: The Lubin School of Business is among the less than three percent of business schools worldwide with dual accreditation from AACSB International—the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business—in both business and accounting.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Business, General
EnglishScore: Official TOEFL, IELTS, or Pearson PTE academic scores are required for all international students.
Description: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) program at the Lubin School of Business is an exciting, contemporary, and professional curriculum, combining comprehensive business education with specialized concentrations. The MBA curriculum integrates a global perspective, social responsibility, ethical decision-making, and technology, providing a strong foundation for a variety of roles within the for-profit, non-profit, and public sectors. The curriculum is flexible, offering in-person and online options, and provides in-depth exploration of eight specialized areas of study: accounting, corporate finance, information systems, investment management, marketing management, strategy and international business, talent management, and business (a general track for non-business undergraduates). By utilizing experiential learning techniques such as consulting projects, case studies, field trips, guest speakers, and research projects, Lubin faculty combine theory and practice to enrich the graduate learning experience.
Accredidation: The Lubin School of Business at Pace University is accredited by AACSB International – The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. AACSB is the premier accrediting organization for business schools in the world. Lubin is dually accredited in both business and accounting, an elite distinction held by fewer than 2% of business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Clinical Psychology, Health Care Emphasis
EnglishScore: International students must also submit results from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS).
Requirements: A bachelor's degree in psychology from an accredited institution. A master's degree in psychology or a related field (e.g., mental health counseling) is encouraged but not required. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.2 is preferred. A minimum of 18 undergraduate credits in psychology, including statistics and research methods. Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores from within the last five years. *Please note that the GREs are NOT required for the application for the Fall 2024 admissions cycle.* Three letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with your academic and/or clinical work. A personal statement describing your interests and goals in clinical psychology, and why our program would be a good fit for you. Please indicate faculty you are interested in working with. A curriculum vitae (CV). An interview.
Department: Dyson College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) program in Clinical Psychology (Health Care Emphasis) provides students with state-of-the-art training in the science and practice of clinical psychology. This program is a natural outgrowth of the department’s commitment to excellent scientist-practitioner training and is a complement to its well-established PsyD program in School-Clinical Child Psychology. The PhD program offers in-depth training in clinical assessment, diagnosis, and psychotherapy. This training is grounded in an understanding and appreciation of the scientific foundations of psychology. Coursework covers psychological theory, research, and practice in areas such as psychopathology, assessment, psychotherapy, health psychology, neuropsychology, research design, and statistics. Through specialized coursework and practica, students will be prepared to work with individuals with mental disorders in medical and other health care settings. The curriculum satisfies the educational requirements for professional psychology licensure in New York and other states.
Accredidation: The PhD in Clinical Psychology (Health Care Emphasis) program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of the American Psychological Association (APA).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Communications and Digital Media
EnglishScore: All students are required to have a high level of English proficiency to be admitted to Pace University. If your native language is not English, you must submit proof of English proficiency by taking one of the following tests and meeting the minimum score requirement: TOEFL, IELTS, Pearson PTE academic, Duolingo English Test, or successful completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Requirements:
In addition to the University graduate admission requirements, the following are required for the MA in Communications and Digital Media program:

- A personal statement (approximately 500 words) addressing the following question: In the field of Communications and Digital Media, it is essential to be a strong storyteller. What is your story? Discuss your personal and professional goals, and how the MA in Communications and Digital Media at Pace University will help you to achieve those goals.
- One letter of recommendation. Recommenders who can speak to a candidate's academic and/or professional potential are preferred.
- Resume.
Department: Dyson College of Arts and Sciences
Fees: The total tuition fee based on the required 36 credits is $51,768.
Description: The Master of Arts in Communications and Digital Media program provides students with the opportunity to acquire sophisticated knowledge about human communication and the skills necessary to succeed in a wide array of communication-related professions in the digital age. This program combines courses in the social sciences and humanities, creating an optimal learning experience for students in an intellectually challenging and professionally relevant curriculum. Our program offers the flexibility of a traditional Master’s program that can be completed entirely online, in-person, or a combination of both. Graduates of this program will be equipped for a broad range of professional positions in private or public sector organizations, as well as for further graduate study leading to a PhD.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Computer Science
EnglishScore: International applicants who have not completed a degree in the US, must submit one of the following: TOEFL (minimum score of 88 iBT), IELTS (minimum score of 7.0), Pearson PTE (minimum score of 61), or Duolingo English Test (minimum score of 115). Successful completion of ELS Language Center’s level 112 may be considered in lieu of TOEFL or IELTS.
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Concentration: ['Advanced Computer Science', 'Artificial Intelligence', 'Cybersecurity', 'Data Science', 'Software Development and Engineering']
Description: The Master of Science in Computer Science is a 30-credit program that provides students with high-quality education to advance their professional careers in the field of computer science. Students in this program will have the opportunity to take a wide range of computer science courses from core areas as well as special topics courses representing the latest developments in computer science. Students in this program will acquire knowledge and skills necessary to advance their career in areas such as software engineering, data science, mobile app development, artificial intelligence, cyber security, and other emerging computer science fields. All students must complete the 30-credit program with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0. The program curriculum is comprised of 10 courses that include three core required courses, three elective courses, and a four-course concentration option in a specific subject area.

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Computer Science
Requirements:
A completed application for admission to the Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems.
Application fee (non-refundable).
Evidence of a master's degree in computer science or a closely related field from an accredited institution. In some cases, a student with a BS in computer science and evidence of a strong research background may be admitted.
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
A minimum undergraduate and graduate grade point average (GPA) of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale.
Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores.
A resume.
Two letters of recommendation from individuals who can comment on the applicant’s potential for success in a doctoral program.
A statement of purpose (approximately 500 words) describing the applicant’s academic and professional background, and goals in seeking a doctoral degree.
For international students whose native language is not English, a minimum Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score of 100 on the internet-based exam or a minimum International English Language Testing System (IELTS) of 7.5 is required.
An interview with the Director of the PhD Program is required. The program director may also ask the student to provide evidence of research and/or software development experience.
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Description: The Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) in Computer Science is a research-based degree program that provides students with the opportunity to work at the forefront of computer science and interdisciplinary applications. The program will equip students with the skills needed to pursue research careers in academia or industry. Students in the program develop strong research skills through close mentorship by faculty members, in-depth study of a research area, and active participation in research activities. The Seidenberg School faculty members are active in a wide range of computer science research areas including, artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, human-computer interaction, mobile computing, networking, and security. Students have the opportunity to participate in ongoing research projects, present their work at conferences, and publish their results in journals. The program is committed to providing a supportive and intellectually stimulating environment for students to pursue their research interests. Students work on cutting-edge research in our research labs including the Cybersecurity Lab, the Robotics Lab, the Networking and Data Science Lab, and others.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Cybersecurity
EnglishScore: Applicants who have not completed their entire undergraduate degree in an English-speaking country must submit proof of English language proficiency. Proof of English proficiency can be one of the following: TOEFL: Minimum score of 88 (iBT), IELTS: Minimum score of 7.0, Pearson PTE: Minimum score of 61, Successful completion of the English Language Institute at Pace University.
Requirements:
In addition to University-wide admission requirements, applicants to this Seidenberg School graduate program are required to submit the following:
- A current resume.
- Two letters of recommendation.
- A personal statement that describes the applicant’s reason for pursuing this graduate degree.
- Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
- GRE is not required.
- Minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Description: The Master of Science in Cybersecurity program provides students with the advanced knowledge and skills in the various technical and managerial aspects of cybersecurity required to be successful in this field. Students learn offensive and defensive cybersecurity, including how to identify and mitigate security vulnerabilities; how to design, implement, and maintain secure systems; and how to manage security policies and procedures. The program prepares students for leadership positions in the cybersecurity field in both the public and private sectors. With a focus on both the theoretical and practical aspects of cybersecurity, students graduate with the skills needed to tackle the most pressing security challenges facing organizations today.
Accredidation: Pace University has been designated by the National Security Agency and the Department of Homeland Security as a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense Education (CAE-CDE) since 2004.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Data Science
EnglishScore: To be considered for admission, international applicants must provide proof of English language proficiency by submitting one of the following: a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 88, a minimum IELTS score of 7.0, a minimum Pearson PTE score of 61, or a minimum Duolingo score of 120.
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Description: The Master of Science in Data Science program at Pace University will prepare you for a career in the rapidly growing field of data science. You’ll gain a deep understanding of subjects like machine learning, big data analytics, and data visualization. The Seidenberg School’s location in the heart of New York City and its close ties with major companies and organizations will provide you with a multitude of internship and employment opportunities to help you build a solid foundation for your career. The MS in Data Science is a STEM-designated 30-credit program. Data science lies at the intersection of computer science and statistics. This program will offer a balanced and comprehensive curriculum on both sides. Students in this program will learn the latest technologies in big data analytics, machine learning, data mining, and data visualization. Students will have opportunities to work on big data projects using real world data sets in our Big Data Lab. The required capstone project will provide students with opportunities to apply what they have learned to solve real world problems.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Homeland Security
EnglishScore: All applicants to Pace University whose first language is not English must submit results of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson PTE, or Duolingo English Test.
Department: Dyson College of Arts and Sciences
Description: As the field of homeland security continues to evolve, our society requires educated leaders and managers to protect the American people where they live and work. The fully online Master of Arts in Homeland Security from Pace University provides a unique opportunity for students to become leaders in the intelligence, law enforcement, and emergency management communities. We prepare you to understand and manage complex issues related to security policies, directives, and legal issues, all while helping you develop advanced skills in intelligence, counter-terrorism, consequence management, and inter-agency cooperation. The online homeland security master’s program is a 36-credit degree program taught by faculty who have served in leadership positions in the FBI, U.S. Secret Service, and the Department of Homeland Security, offering a unique opportunity to learn from and network with professionals actively working in the field.
ScholarshipType: Need-based, Merit-based, Military benefits (Yellow Ribbon Program, GI Bill)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Education, Literacy Specialist
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit a Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score report.
Requirements: In addition to general university admission requirements, applicants must submit the following: a completed online application and application fee, two letters of recommendation, official college/university transcripts from all institutions attended, a resume, and a personal statement. The Master of Science in Education in Literacy Specialist is designed for candidates who hold initial certification in a related field. Candidates must show evidence of having completed coursework or its equivalent in the following four areas: Child/Adolescent Development, Foundations of Education, Teaching Students with Special Needs, and Literacy. GRE/GMAT scores are not required for most School of Education graduate programs.
Description:
The School of Education offers a Master of Science in Education (MSED) in Literacy Specialist that leads to New York State certification for teachers who already possess initial certification in a related area. The program has two tracks: Birth-Grade 6 and Grades 5-12. Successful completion of the program and passing of the New York State Content Specialty Test in Literacy will lead to professional certification in teaching for candidates who have three years of teaching experience, including one year of literacy teaching experience with a mentor.
Program Goals/Outcomes
Upon completion of the program, students will be able to:
1. Demonstrate knowledge of the foundations of literacy.
2. Use a wide range of instructional practices, approaches, methods, and curriculum materials to support reading and writing instruction.
3. Use a variety of assessment tools and practices to plan and evaluate effective literacy instruction.
4. Create a literate environment that fosters reading and writing by integrating foundational knowledge, instructional practices, and curricular materials.
5. View literacy as a developmental process and implement instruction appropriate to the needs of the emerging, developing, and fluent reader.
Accredidation: Pace University’s School of Education is nationally accredited by the Association for Advancing Quality in Educator Preparation (AAQEP).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Physician Assistant Studies Completion Program
ScholarshipType: Pace Graduate Grants, Pace Grad Scholarships, External Scholarship Opportunities

ProgramName: Master of Science in Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner Program
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take one of the following English proficiency examinations: TOEFL, IELTS, or Pearson PTE.
Requirements: In addition to University-wide graduate admission requirements, applicants to the Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner Program must also submit/meet the following: A current New York State license as a registered professional nurse. A Bachelor of Science degree with a major in nursing from a CCNE or ACEN accredited program. Official transcripts from all post-secondary schools attended. A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0. Two letters of recommendation, one from a faculty member and one from a current employer/supervisor. A resume. A personal statement. Successful completion of an undergraduate statistics course with a minimum grade of a C. At least one year of full-time work experience as a registered nurse in a medical/surgical, psychiatric, or pediatric setting within the last 5 years is required. An interview with the program director or faculty member may be requested.
Department: College of Health Professions, Lienhard School of Nursing
Description: The Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) Program is a 42-credit Master of Science program for baccalaureate prepared registered nurses. Students are prepared to provide primary psychiatric and mental health care across the lifespan. The program builds on the undergraduate nursing foundation and provides advanced didactic and clinical practice in psychiatric mental health. Graduates are eligible to take the American Nurses Credentialing Center’s (ANCC) national certification examination for Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioners (Across the Lifespan). The PMHNP program is offered in an online format. Students come to campus at the beginning of each clinical course for an on-campus residency which will consist of lab, simulation, and other learning experiences.
Accredidation: The master's degree program in nursing...at Pace University are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).
ScholarshipType: Merit-based scholarships, assistantships, and need-based grants

ProgramName: Master of Public Administration in Public Administration
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) or the Pearson Test of English (PTE) or Duolingo.
Department: Dyson College of Arts and Sciences
Concentration: Government Management, Healthcare Administration, Nonprofit Management
Description: Pace University's Master of Public Administration (MPA) program has been educating and training leaders in public service for over 30 years. Our MPA program prepares students to become leaders who can address society’s most difficult managerial, economic, and social problems. We are looking for students who are committed to a public service career in a variety of fields including government, healthcare, and nonprofit management. The Pace MPA program gives students the necessary skills to effectively manage in this ever-changing environment, with an opportunity for specialization within the field. Students learn to effectively lead and manage organizations, develop and implement policy, and think strategically to anticipate and respond to the myriad challenges facing government and nonprofit organizations. Our accomplished faculty have deep subject matter expertise that they bring to the classroom from professional work as senior government officials, nonprofit executives, and public affairs consultants. Pace University’s MPA program is offered fully online and through a hybrid model that blends online and in-person classes.
Accredidation: The Master of Public Administration Program is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Public Affairs and Administration (NASPAA), the recognized accrediting body of graduate public administration programs in the United States.

ProgramName: Master of Public Health in Public Health
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT - 88, IELTS - 7.0, Pearson PTE - 61, Duolingo English Test - 115, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Description: The Master of Public Health (MPH) program is designed to provide graduate, professional education for individuals who seek careers in the field of public health. The program is offered fully online to ensure maximum accessibility to graduate students, working professionals, career changers, and those currently working in the public health or health professions who seek to advance their careers. The curriculum is based on the traditional pillars of public health, which are biostatistics, environmental health sciences, epidemiology, health policy and management, and social and behavioral sciences. Students in the program develop knowledge and skills in these core areas and apply this knowledge to the practice of public health through elective course offerings and the completion of an applied practice experience and a culminating integrated learning experience.
Accredidation: The Master of Public Health (MPH) program is accredited by the Council on Education for Public Health (CEPH).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Publishing
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Pace University accepts the following tests and scores: TOEFL (minimum score of 88 on the iBT), IELTS (minimum score of 7.0), Pearson PTE (minimum score of 61), or Duolingo English Test (minimum score of 115).
Department: Dyson College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Publishing is a 36-credit-hour program that combines the study of print and digital media from books and magazines to websites, ebooks, and apps. The program is committed to offering an education that meets the needs of a rapidly changing industry by giving students a strong foundation in both print and digital publishing. In addition to a variety of courses in book and magazine publishing, the program's curriculum includes courses in financial management and business strategies, editing, intellectual property, marketing, websites, ebooks, mobile applications, design, and distribution. Students are encouraged to develop a specialty in either book publishing or magazine publishing. All classes are taught by leading executives in the publishing industry. Graduates go on to work at some of the world's most prestigious publishing houses. And, our location in the media capital of the world—New York City—gives our students the opportunity to learn from the best in the industry and make vital career connections. Publishing students have the chance to serve as staff members of the student-run literary magazine, Aphros, and to work in the publishing office, which produces a nationally distributed book each year.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Software Development and Engineering
EnglishScore: International students must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL iBT (minimum 88), IELTS (minimum 7.0), Pearson PTE (minimum 61), or Duolingo English Test (minimum 115).
Requirements: Applicants to the MS in Software Development and Engineering are required to have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related STEM discipline from an accredited institution with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Applicants must also submit the following: Online application; Application fee; Transcripts from all prior institutions; Resume; Personal statement; Two letters of recommendation; Official GRE scores (optional); Proof of English proficiency (for international students).
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Description: Lead the charge on the latest technologies with a Master of Science in Software Development and Engineering from Pace University’s Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems. You will develop an in-depth understanding of the concepts and principles of software development and engineering, learn about emerging technologies, and learn to apply this knowledge to real-world problems. The software development and engineering master’s program will provide a path to a career as a software engineer, software developer, enterprise software architect, or team leader through project-based learning. Throughout your coursework, you will have opportunities to engage in the design, development, and testing of complex software systems. In addition to a variety of elective courses, students in the software development and engineering master’s program have the option of pursuing a six-credit master’s thesis.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Bilingual Education
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Pace University accepts the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, Pearson PTE, and Duolingo English Test. The minimum required scores are: TOEFL iBT: 88, IELTS: 7.0, Pearson PTE: 61, Duolingo English Test: 115.
Requirements:
A master's degree from an accredited institution of higher education with a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
A New York State initial, professional, or permanent teaching certificate in any area.
An on-site writing sample in both English and in the target language of instruction (Spanish, Chinese, or Haitian Creole).
An interview with program faculty to be conducted in both English and the target language of instruction.
A personal statement in English describing your interest in bilingual education.
Description: The Advanced Certificate in Bilingual Education is for teachers who hold initial or professional certification in a content area or in teaching English to speakers of other languages (TESOL) and who wish to obtain the New York State Bilingual Education Extension. The program provides the candidate with the theoretical and practical knowledge needed to work in a variety of bilingual settings. Candidates will deepen their understanding of cultural, linguistic, and contextual diversity as they work with linguistically diverse students and their families.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Early Childhood Extension Certification (Birth-Grade 2)
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English language proficiency. The following are the English language proficiency tests and the minimum scores accepted by Pace University: TOEFL: 80 (iBT), IELTS: 6.5, Pearson PTE academic: 54. Pace University is now accepting the Duolingo English Test. The minimum required score is 115. Successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center in the United States.
Requirements:
Applicants to the Early Childhood Extension Certification program must hold initial, provisional, permanent, or professional certification in one of the following areas:

- Childhood Education (Grades 1-6)
- Literacy (Birth-Grade 6)
- Students with Disabilities (Birth-Grade 2)
- Students with Disabilities (Grades 1-6)

In addition, applicants must submit:
- A completed online application
- A non-refundable application fee
- Two letters of recommendation
- A resume listing your chronological employment history
- A personal statement (300-500 words) describing your purpose and goals in undertaking graduate study
- Official college transcripts from all colleges and/or universities attended
Description: The Advanced Certificate in Early Childhood Extension Certification (Birth-Grade 2) program is for certified teachers who want to expand their knowledge and expertise to include the education of young children. This 12-credit certificate program is for teachers who hold an initial or professional certificate in Childhood Education (grades 1-6) and wish to obtain an extension certification to teach in early childhood settings (birth-grade 2).

ProgramName: Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Integrated Instruction for Literacy and Technology
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will need to submit proof of English proficiency. Pace University accepts several methods to prove your English proficiency, including TOEFL, IELTS, Pearson PTE, and the Duolingo English Test.
Description: The School of Education offers a 12-credit, fully online, advanced graduate certificate in Integrated Instruction for Literacy and Technology. The curriculum addresses theory, research, and evidence-based practices needed by teachers to integrate technology effectively in K-12 classrooms. Technology is emphasized as a medium for learning across the curriculum for all students.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Middle School Extension Certification
EnglishScore: All applicants for whom English is a second language must submit results of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Pearson Test of English (PTE). Minimum scores are: TOEFL 88 iBT, IELTS 7.0, PTE 61. Duolingo English Test (115 minimum score) will be accepted for graduate applicants.
Fees: $8,640 for the entire program (6 credits at $1,440/credit)
Concentration: English, Mathematics, Social Studies, Biology, Chemistry, Earth Science, and Physics
Description: The Advanced Certificate in Middle School Extension Certification is available for graduate candidates who hold a Masters Degree and initial certification in Childhood Education 1-6. This certificate extends the grade level for the certification area to include grades 7-9. It is offered for the following content areas: English, Mathematics, Social Studies, Biology, Chemistry, Earth Science, and Physics.
Accredidation: All teacher education, school counseling, and school psychology programs are accredited by the Association for Advancing Quality in Educator preparation (AAQEP).

ProgramName: Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) Certificate
EnglishScore: For applicants for whom English is a second language, a minimum TOEFL score of 88 (IBT) or IELTS score of 7.0 is required.
Requirements:
In addition to University requirements, applicants to the Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) program must provide the following:

1. Master's degree in nursing from a CCNE or ACEN accredited program from a college or university.
2. Current professional registered nurse license and current registration in New York State.
3. Resume or curriculum vitae.
4. Personal Statement.
5. Two letters of recommendation, one professional and one academic.
6. A grade point average of 3.0 or better is preferred.
7. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
8. TOEFL or IELTS scores for applicants for whom English is a second language.
9. A personal interview may be required.
Description: The Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) Certificate of Advanced Graduate Studies (CAGS) program is designed to prepare master’s and doctorally prepared nurses for advanced practice as a psychiatric mental health nurse practitioner (PMHNP). The CAGS is a non-degree granting program of study that is competency-based, providing core content in psychiatric mental health advanced practice nursing across the lifespan. Emphasis is on assessment and diagnosis of psychiatric disorders and co-morbid conditions; psychopharmacology, individual, group and family psychotherapy; and management of psychiatric disorders of patients across the lifespan. Students complete approximately 500 hours of supervised clinical practice. Upon completion of this program, graduates are eligible for New York State certification as a Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner and are eligible for national board certification by the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) as a Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and Doctor of Nursing Practice program at Pace University are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, 202-887-6791.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Security and Information Assurance
EnglishScore: All students whose native language is not English must take an English proficiency examination. Pace University accepts the following English proficiency examinations: TOEFL, IELTS, Pearson PTE, and Duolingo.
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Description: The Secure Software and Information Engineering certificate program is intended for students who wish to specialize in the field of secure software engineering and information security and assurance. The program prepares students to understand the nature of secure software, and how to design, develop, and test such systems. Topics covered in this certificate program include secure software design, analysis, and testing, risk management, data mining for security, software security, network security, and cryptography. Students may complete this certificate program only, or apply these credits toward a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Software Engineering.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Software Engineering Development
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency.
Requirements: Applicants to the Advanced Certificate in Software Engineering Development are required to hold a bachelor's degree in computer science from an accredited institution. Applicants who do not have a bachelor’s degree in computer science, but have a bachelor’s degree in another field with a strong academic record (GPA of 3.0 or better) and substantial professional experience as a software developer, will also be considered for admission. All applicants must submit: Completed online application form, Application fee, Transcripts from all post-secondary schools attended, Resume, Statement of Purpose. In addition, all applicants must submit a separate departmental application to the Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems.
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Description: The Advanced Certificate in Software Development and Engineering (SDE) is designed for students who want to become a software engineer with advanced knowledge and practical skills for developing and managing large-scale software systems. This 12-credit graduate certificate offers a fast track to a software engineering career for students with an undergraduate degree in a related field and prior programming experience. The SDE program focuses on core concepts of the entire software development lifecycle, including requirements analysis, design, implementation, testing and maintenance. Students will learn the latest software engineering methodology and gain hands-on experience using modern development tools, techniques and technologies.

ProgramName: Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Special Education: Teaching Students with Disabilities (All Grades)
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take either the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Pearson Test of English (PTE). Pace University also accepts the Duolingo English Test. The minimum scores required for admission are: TOEFL 80 internet-based (iBT) or 550 paper-based (PBT); IELTS 6.5; PTE 54; or Duolingo 115. Completion of ELS Level 112 with a grade of B or higher is also accepted.
Requirements:
In addition to the University graduate admission requirements, the School of Education requires the following for admission to this program:

- Master's degree in education from an accredited university.
- New York State initial or professional teacher certification in Childhood Education (grades 1-6) or Adolescent Education (grades 7-12) in a content area.
- A minimum cumulative graduate GPA of 3.0.
- Two letters of recommendation.
- A statement of purpose.
- An individual interview.
- Resume
Description: The Certificate of Advanced Study (CAS) in Special Education is a 30-36 credit program that prepares candidates to work with students with disabilities from birth-grade 12. Candidates may choose from three specializations: Early Childhood (birth-grade 2), Childhood (grades 1-6), or Adolescence (grades 7-12). This advanced certificate program meets the academic requirements for initial and professional New York State certification in Teaching Students with Disabilities in the area of specialization selected.
Accredidation: All teacher preparation programs, and school counseling, school psychology, and school-district business leader programs are registered and approved by the New York State Education Department. The teacher preparation programs are also accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Teaching English as a Second Language (TESOL)
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate English language proficiency. Proficiency can be demonstrated by submitting official TOEFL, IELTS, Pearson PTE, or Duolingo English Test scores. Minimum scores required for admission are: TOEFL Internet-based (iBT): 88, IELTS: 7.0, Pearson PTE: 61, Duolingo English Test: 115.
Description: The Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Teaching English as a Second Language (TESOL) is an 18-credit program for applicants who already possess a master’s degree and are certified teachers. It is designed to extend teachers’ knowledge and skills to include English language learners in K–12 settings. This program of study includes course work and field experience, leading to New York State certification in TESOL. All courses in this program have been approved by the New York State Department of Education.
Accredidation: All programs leading to licensure in the School of Education are accredited by the Association for Advancing Quality in Educator Preparation (AAQEP). All courses in this program have been approved by the New York State Department of Education.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Corporate Finance
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must submit a Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score. Pace University also accepts the Pearson PTE academic test (minimum score of 61) and successful completion of the ELS 112 course as proof of English proficiency. The Duolingo English Test is also accepted with a minimum score of 115.
Requirements: In addition to the University requirements, applicants to all MBA and MS programs must submit a current resume, an essay/statement of purpose, two letters of recommendation, and an official GMAT or GRE score report. GMAT/GRE is optional for candidates with an undergraduate GPA of 3.2 or above from an accredited U.S. institution and for other qualified applicants.
Description: The Lubin MBA in Business Administration provides students with the critical skills and knowledge necessary to successfully lead and manage organizations in a dynamic global business environment. This degree includes in-depth study in key functional areas of business and a strong emphasis on developing the analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills necessary for effective decision-making and leadership. Students develop practical experience through case analyses, consulting assignments for businesses and not-for-profit organizations, and by participating in programs and centers unique to Lubin, including the Interactive and Direct Marketing (IDM) Lab, the Center for Global Business Programs, and the Center for Student Enterprise. The Lubin MBA is a 39-credit program with eight concentrations: Accounting, Corporate Finance, Information Systems, Investment Management, Marketing, Marketing Analytics, Strategy and International Business, and Talent Management.
Accredidation: The Lubin School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International. This is the premier accrediting organization for business schools in the world. Pace University is accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education.
ScholarshipType: Pace Graduate Grants, Pace Graduate Scholarships, Graduate Assistantships

ProgramName: Master of Science in Health Informatics
EnglishScore: English proficiency scores (TOEFL, IELTS, or Pearson PTE academic). The required TOEFL score is 88 (iBT), IELTS is 7.0, and Pearson PTE academic is 61.
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Description: The Master of Science in Health Informatics prepares students for careers in the healthcare industry. The curriculum provides students with a solid foundation in health informatics. They take courses in data management, analytics and machine learning, security and privacy, UX and usability, mobile applications and systems, and healthcare leadership. They gain the necessary knowledge and skills in information technology and healthcare to support the needs of healthcare organizations.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Human Centered Design
EnglishScore: All applicants for graduate admission whose native language is not English must demonstrate English language proficiency by submitting official scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson PTE, or the Duolingo English Test.
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Description: The Master of Science (MS) in Human-Centered Design (HCD) at Pace University is a unique interdisciplinary program that bridges the gap between art and information technology. Human-centered design places people at the forefront of the design process to create products, services, systems, and experiences that are not only useful but also usable and desirable. The HCD program provides students with practical research methods and design techniques to understand human needs, behaviors, and motivations. Students learn to conduct user research, analyze data, prototype ideas, and test designs with real users. The curriculum combines hands-on studio work with theoretical coursework, enabling students to develop a strong portfolio and a deep understanding of the principles of human-centered design. Students will learn the essentials of design thinking, user experience (UX) design, interaction design, information architecture, usability testing, and visual design. Graduates of the program will be prepared for careers as UX designers, interaction designers, product designers, user researchers, information architects, and UX strategists in a wide range of industries, including technology, healthcare, finance, and entertainment. The program is suitable for students from diverse backgrounds, including art, design, computer science, psychology, and business. No prior design or programming experience is required.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Information Systems
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency by submitting results from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson PTE, or Duolingo English Test.
Department: Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems
Description: The Master of Science degree in Information Systems is an innovative program that blends management and technology. It is a STEM designated program. Students in the Information Systems master's program can opt for the general MS in IS degree or choose from one of two concentrations: Data Science or User Experience Design. All MS in IS students will learn to formulate and solve business problems by analyzing organizational data, designing data-driven services and products, and managing technology resources. Specifically, the MS in IS program focuses on key data and information management principles, data analytics, IT infrastructure, and data-driven decision making. The program is designed for students with diverse backgrounds, including business, liberal arts and sciences, and computer science. Our graduates are highly sought after by employers because they have a unique blend of business and technology skills. They understand how organizations work, how to identify business opportunities, and how to develop technology-enabled solutions. Information Systems graduates are prepared for careers that are in high demand in today's digital economy, such as business and systems analysts, data scientists, UX designers, technology consultants, and project managers.
ScholarshipPercentage: Awards vary in amount but do not exceed one-half of the tuition charges for the academic year.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Applied Quantitative Economic Analysis and Policy
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency examination. Pace University accepts the following examinations: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 88 on the iBT (internet-based version) or 570 on the PBT (paper-based version); IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum overall band score of 7.0; Pearson PTE academic with a minimum score of 61; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 115.
Requirements:
In addition to the University graduate admission requirements, the following are required:

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution, with a preferred GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
A current resume.
A personal statement that addresses the applicant’s reason for pursuing this degree and their career goals.
Two letters of recommendation.
GRE general test scores (optional).
For international applicants, an official TOEFL, IELTS, or Pearson PTE academic score is required. For minimum score requirements and country exemptions, please visit the International Graduate Admission webpage.
Department: Dyson College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Applied Quantitative Economic Analysis and Policy is a 30-credit hour program that provides students with a strong foundation in economic and econometric theory as well as the tools of economic policy analysis. This program is STEM designated. Students will learn the tools necessary to analyze data, assess the impact of public policy, and to communicate the results of their analyses to a wide variety of audiences. The degree provides students with the advanced quantitative and applied research skills needed for careers as economic and policy analysts in the private and public sectors, and in non-profit organizations. Students gain expertise in a variety of software packages, including STATA, SAS, and R. The Master of Science in Applied Quantitative Economic Analysis and Policy degree culminates in a semester-long capstone project supervised by a full-time faculty member.

ProgramName: Master in Bilingual School Psychology
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL (minimum 78 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), Pearson PTE (minimum 52), or Duolingo English Test (minimum 115).
Department: Dyson College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The specialization in bilingual school psychology leads to the Master of Science in Education (MSEd) degree in School Psychology and eligibility for New York State certiﬁcation as a School Psychologist and the Bilingual Education Extension to the certiﬁcate. The program prepares graduates to provide a full range of school psychological services for diverse student populations. The program is committed to a multicultural perspective and seeks to recruit a diverse student body. Candidates are prepared as practitioners who can apply psychological principles to educational settings to help resolve learning and behavioral problems in children and adolescents. The program is designed to develop competencies in consultation, assessment, counseling, and research. There is special emphasis on developing multicultural competencies for working in urban schools. Students take a number of specialized courses to develop competence in working with culturally and linguistically diverse children and families and are placed in externship and internship sites with bilingual populations.
Accredidation: The program is approved by the National Association of School Psychologists (NASP) and registered by the New York State Department of Education.

ProgramName: Master in Childhood Education
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take one of the following English proficiency examinations: TOEFL (minimum score of 88 on the iBT), IELTS (minimum score of 7.0), Pearson PTE (minimum score of 61), or Duolingo English Test (DET) (minimum score of 115).
Requirements: In addition to the University graduate admission requirements, the School of Education requires the following for admission to this program: A current resume. A personal statement, approximately 250-500 words, that describes your reasons for pursuing the degree. Two letters of recommendation. An official transcript from each college or university attended. A bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited institution. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0. A major of at least 30 credits in a liberal art or science. Completion of the liberal arts and science prerequisite coursework (see below).
Description: The Master of Science in Education in Childhood Education program is designed for students who have completed an undergraduate or graduate degree in a field other than education and are seeking a master’s degree and initial certification to teach in childhood settings (grades 1–6). Our program has a strong student-teaching component that provides students with numerous opportunities to work with children in a variety of school settings. Students in this program are not required to have a major in a specific content area but must have a broad liberal arts background.
Accredidation: Pace University’s School of Education is accredited by The Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). This accreditation covers initial teacher preparation programs and advanced educator preparation programs. CAEP is recognized by the U.S. Department of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation to accredit programs for the preparation of teachers and other professional school personnel.

ProgramName: Master in Childhood Education and TESOL
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English language proficiency examination. Pace University accepts the following examinations: TOEFL with a minimum score of 88 on the IBT, or 570 on the paper-based test; IELTS with a minimum score of 7.0; Pearson PTE Academic with a minimum score of 61; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 115.
Requirements: Admission to all School of Education graduate programs requires the following: a completed online application form, a nonrefundable application fee, official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended, two letters of recommendation, a personal statement (500 words), and a resume. Official Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores are required if applicable.
Description: The Master of Science for Teachers (MST) in Childhood Education and TESOL is a 43-credit program that prepares candidates to work with children in grades 1-6 and English language learners in grades K-12. This program is for candidates who have a bachelor's degree in a liberal arts or sciences area, but do not have a teaching degree. The program leads to dual initial certification in Childhood Education and TESOL. Candidates must complete a liberal arts and sciences core of 30 credits and show evidence of college-level study in four areas: artistic expression, communication and humanities, a language other than English, and scientific and mathematical processes. This program is available at both the New York City and Westchester campuses.
Accredidation: The School of Education at Pace University is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). This accreditation covers initial teacher preparation programs and advanced educator preparation programs.

ProgramName: Master in Childhood and Bilingual Education
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be accomplished by submitting official score reports from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson PTE academic, or Duolingo English Test (DET).
Requirements:
General Admission Requirements for all School of Education Master’s and Advanced Certificate Programs include:

1. A completed online application.
2. A non-refundable application fee.
3. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0. A copy of a transcript from each college or university attended is required. Official transcripts must be submitted directly from all previously attended institutions prior to enrollment.
4. Two letters of recommendation from academic or professional sources.
5. A personal statement (300-500 words).
6. A professional resume.
7. Successful completion of all prerequisite coursework.
Concentration: Foreign Language, Mathematics, Science, Social Studies, Literacy
Description: The School of Education offers a 43-credit program leading to a Master of Science in Teaching (MST) in Childhood and Bilingual Education. The program is specifically designed to meet the needs of those students who do not have an undergraduate degree in teacher education. This program is for individuals holding a baccalaureate degree with a liberal arts or sciences major who have had little or no previous coursework in professional education. Students in this program take a sequence of courses leading to eligibility for New York State certification to teach Childhood Education (grades 1-6) with a Bilingual Extension. All students in this program must also choose an area of concentration in either a Foreign Language, Mathematics, Science, Social Studies or Literacy in order to obtain Initial Certification in Childhood Education and a Bilingual Extension.
Accredidation: The School of Education at Pace University is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) for a period of 7 years, from 2020-2027. This accreditation covers initial teacher preparation programs and advanced educator preparation programs on both the New York City and Westchester campuses.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mental Health Counseling
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Pace University accepts the following tests to satisfy this requirement: TOEFL IBT: 88, IELTS: 7.0, Pearson PTE: 61, or Duolingo English Test (DET): 115.
Requirements:
The general requirements for admission to graduate study at Pace University are listed in the Graduate Admission section of this catalog. In addition, the following is required for admission to the Master of Science degree program in Mental Health Counseling:

1. A completed application form and fee.
2. Official transcripts from all post-secondary schools attended. An undergraduate scholastic average of 3.0 or better is required.
3. Bachelor’s degree in psychology or a related field (e.g., sociology, anthropology, etc.). Eighteen credits of psychology coursework are a prerequisite for admission to the program (undergraduate or graduate credits can be used). These credits must include Introduction to Psychology, Abnormal Psychology (or Psychopathology), Statistics, and Research Methods. Any missing prerequisites can be taken upon admission to the program at the undergraduate level, but will not count towards the graduate degree.
4. Two letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with the applicant’s academic or professional abilities.
5. A personal statement of 500-1000 words describing the applicant's reasons for applying to the MS in Mental Health Counseling Program, as well as career goals.
6. A resume detailing education and work experience.
7. Standardized test scores (GRE General Test: verbal, quantitative, and writing scores) are not required for admission.
8. For International students whose native language is not English, a minimum TOEFL score of 88 on the Internet-based test is required.
9. An interview may be required.
Department: Dyson College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Master of Science (MS) in Mental Health Counseling degree program is a 60-credit, license-qualifying program that prepares graduates to provide professional counseling services in a wide array of mental health settings. Our program is grounded in a practitioner-scholar model, in which students are guided to base their counseling practice on established theories and evidence-based practices and research. Students will learn the fundamental skills of counseling and psychotherapy and become adept at working with a variety of client populations. The program is designed to meet the academic requirements for licensure as a Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC) in New York State. Through coursework and supervised field experiences, students gain the requisite knowledge and skills to be eligible to apply for a limited permit upon graduation and to begin the process of completing the post-graduate hours necessary to apply for full licensure. The curriculum also has a strong focus on multicultural competence, advocacy, and social justice and how these factors influence the counseling process.

ProgramName: Master in Adolescent Education
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take one of the following English proficiency exams: TOEFL, IELTS, Pearson PTE, or Duolingo English Test (DET). The minimum TOEFL score required for graduate admission is 88 (Internet-based test). The minimum IELTS score required for graduate admission is 7.0. The minimum Pearson PTE score required for graduate admission is 61. The minimum Duolingo English Test (DET) score required for graduate admission is 115. Completion of ELS Language Center’s Level 112 is also accepted.
Requirements: A completed online application, a $70 non-refundable application fee, official transcripts from each college or university attended, a professional/academic resume, a personal statement (300-500 words), and two letters of recommendation are required. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 is also required. Standardized tests (i.e. GRE) are not required for School of Education graduate program applicants.
Description:
The Master of Science for Teachers (MST) in Adolescent Education program is for individuals who hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in a specific content area and are looking for an initial certification to teach students in grades 7 through 12. Pace University’s School of Education offers this program in a variety of content areas: biology, chemistry, earth science, English, mathematics, physics, social studies, and Spanish.

Our MST programs blend in-class studies and fieldwork to prepare graduates to be highly effective teachers who promote student learning and development in their chosen content area and grade level.
